issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: YARN-8319 filter check for flows pages. The same behavior need to be added for all other REST API as long as ATS provides support for ACLs
fields.summary: Add basic ACL check for all ATS v2 REST APIs

This message was automatically generated.

[~rohithsharma]

Can we also sync the exception handling similar to RMWebServices. IIRC all the stack trace was avoided in RMWebServices.
Currently {{TimelineReaderWebServices}} throws complete stacktrace as part for response.

Also {{AccessControlException}} is thrown as {{INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR}} now if the table acl is not available for reader rt ??
Can we make it more detail.

bq. Can we also sync the exception handling similar to RMWebServices.
Patch is doing similar to RMwebService by throwing forbidden exception. It is only exception which doesn't have bigger stack trace compared to others since it created in reader web service. 

bq. Also AccessControlException is thrown as INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR now if the table acl is not available for reader rt ??
Currently we don't have any ACL story. This is very basic  strict restriction that two authenticated user can't see each others data. We have complete ACL coming up and it is in progress. Default flow doesn't hit this check in any case.
Thanks [~sunilg] for the review. Attached patch along with tests added for newly added methods..

Thanks [~rohithsharma] for testing and verifying the same.

Latest refactoring looks more cleaner to me. Also cross verified that the latest change is not coming in default flow rather it will be validated only when display-per-entity is enabled from YARN.

Committing this shortly.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14501 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14501/])
